main.name: Enrico Elizan Jr.
main.description: I have an affinity for building applications of all types.
main.bio: Hello, my name is Enrico Elizan Jr. Recently graduated from Georgia State University with a Bachelors in Computer Science. I'm emerging into the programming world with the goal to create and be a part of beautiful projects and applications. Difficult projects are the reason I do this, life isn't fun without challenges! Don't hesitate to contact me for any work or collaborations!

education.description: The B.S. degree program in computer science at GSU provides preparation in the fundamental principles and processes of computation and training in applying these principles in application areas in industry, science, government, and business.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: As a Software Engineer, I worked within a Web Development team focused on UI / UX enhancements as well as creating and linking to asynchronous RESTful api calls. I leverage my knowledge of responsive design and community frameworks including Bootstrap, JQuery and the MVC Framework of ASP.NET. I utilize my working knowledge and experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and C#.

work.company: CETL, Georgia State University, Downtown Campus
work.title: Information Technology Support Technician
work.description: Working in a fast-paced, higher education institution accountable to ensure that all of our student's instructional experiences are effective, efficient and productive through the following primary activities: Set up, maintain, configure and administer classroom software such as Panapto and Pharos, Provide desktop support through troubleshooting PC Desktop and Telecom related problems, and  Proactively respond to requests for technical assistance in person and via phone.

work.company: IS&T, Georgia State University, Alpharetta Campus
work.title: Student Technician
work.description: Working in a fast-paced, higher education institution accountable to ensure that all of our student's instructional experiences are effective, efficient and productive through the following primary activities: Set up, maintain, configure and administer classroom software such as Panapto and Pharos, Provide desktop support through troubleshooting PC Desktop and Telecom related problems, and  Proactively respond to requests for technical assistance in person and via phone.

work.title: Summer Intern
work.description: Was hand selected based upon grades, academic achievement, and domain knowledge to work in an industry-leading Insurance organization to provide their employees best-in-class Information Technology support. Following duties included: Queried and maintained the MetaVance database using Oracle SQL, assisted in administering Windows/Linux servers, assisted in administering storage discs of the AS400 database, provided desktop support by troubleshooting PC desktop / telecommunications related problems, and responded to requests for technical assistance in person and via phone

projects.title: Smart Fridge
projects.description: Using Raspberry Pi to repeatedly fetch product data from a fridge and execute specific operations accordingly â€“ reorder from an ecommerce site, notify user, CRUD operations

projects.title: Conway's Game of Life
projects.description: Built using Javascript. The Game of Life, also known simply as Life, is a cellular automaton game.The game is a zero-player game, meaning that its evolution is determined by its initial state, requiring no further input.

projects.title: Dijkstra's Algorithm with Binary Heaps
projects.description: Finds the shortest path of nodes and edges from a text file with a time complexity of O(ELogV)

projects.title: Game Store
projects.description: Fully functional E-Commerce platform built with the LAMP stack and the Codeignighter framework.
